summary: All static analysis checks passed. The project is properly configured and ready to build and run.

source_code_quality.description: Source code syntax and structure validation

details.message: main.py compiled successfully, no syntax errors
game.py compiled successfully, no syntax errors
config.py compiled successfully, no syntax errors
All modules (config, game, main) can be imported successfully
main.py has proper if __name__ == '__main__' guard and Game().run() entry point
Well-organized code with Player, Shell, and Game classes
main.py entry point found at project root
All required modules present: main.py, game.py, config.py
pygame 2.6.1 imports successfully, SDL 2.28.4 available
Both run.bat (Windows) and run.sh (Linux/Mac) present
All required configuration constants defined (SCREEN_WIDTH, SCREEN_HEIGHT, FPS, colors, physics, player, shell settings)
Game class properly initializes pygame, display, clock, and fonts
Game.get_observation() returns player and shell state
Game.get_action_space() returns ['LEFT', 'RIGHT', 'JUMP', 'NONE']
Game.step(action) implements RL agent interface with observation, reward, done, info return
Reward structure matches specification: +10 per bounce, +0.01 per frame, -100 game over
Observation includes: player_x, player_y, shell_x, shell_y, shell_velocity_x, is_grounded
Comprehensive README.md with build/start/stop/play instructions
appinfo.json contains all required metadata
Main classes and functions have docstrings
README includes RL action space, observation space, and reward function documentation
run.bat present with proper Windows batch syntax
run.sh present with shebang and bash syntax
Code uses relative imports, no hardcoded platform-specific paths
uv.lock includes wheels for win32, win_amd64, macOS, and manylinux platforms

recommendations.message: Consider adding type hints for better code maintainability
Consider adding unit tests for core game logic
Consider adding inline comments for complex physics calculations
